after several moments praising the wonders of stenciling, and with the antlers now being licked off my upper lip, i've decided that i will not let my good ideas go to waste. no, i will not be a procrastinator, i will not abuse time! in the recent issue of the urlLink Harvard Business Review, "chronic time abuse" was categorized into four styles of procrastination each with medically experted justifications from psychological understandings to causes in early child development. i, however will take full responsibiltiy of not getting my act together and in so doing i have compiled the following list of short term goals: finish urlLink naruwan productions business plan complete new york state non-profit laws sourcing re-translate "naboo translations" start magazine translations for biung by announcing this to the world, i hope to create for myself a sense of pressure or at least motivation to accomplish these goals faster ! it would seem though, that in 'abusing time' i am also abusing space and since i would like to think that i do have a right to my space by virtue of the fact that i exist, i will start on my list immediately. urlLink accompanying photo
i think if i were to get on a plane today, i would go to some small island in the south pacific...or india. urlLink weeeeee!

In spite of the announcement i made to the world yesterday, i've managed to spend yet another morning blogging. though this new found hobbie is both entertaining and a way for me to release / refocus my energies, its not helping me complete my list of short term goals. but today is different because today i have the morning off while urlLink biung and little but big bro urlLink Bali are off to practice Brazillian Ultimate Fighting Champ, urlLink Gracie-style fighting later in the afternoon. our new schedule in effect is as follows: monday and fridays i get the morning off, since biung's on the late shift. thurdays biung practices brazillian fighting in the afternoon while i get the morning off--thats 3 mornings a week! i was so excited today that i thought i'd blog and delay getting to my list, i still have the afternoon anyhow. yet, it's already 1pm and i've skipped lunch it seems and biung and soliel will be here any minute. as for the evening, we're heading to the urlLink hot springs (where biung works) for music and fun and i think i'll do some swimming too since the urlLink foundation has a urlLink nice pool . tomorrow, i'll hit the beach--in the morning! urlLink hotspring overview photo
urlLink soliel

Soliel Istanda, born November 22, 2003, has both U.S. and Taiwanese citizenship. though she is but a bouncing hooby booby humble bumble bee, she now has two teeth coming in and has developed a knack for gathering attention by way of screaming in high pitch tones. she is quite the early bird, rising at 5am - 6am every morning and yes--she will get her worm. she does not suck on her fingers but she does pull hair. her latest trick is 'kissing', as she will kiss when you say so though, her kisses are open mouthed, and with tounge. soliel's best friend is urlLink a.j. and the two challenge each other daily. soliel likes her milk from a glass bottle, she likes to urlLink eat baby food when the grown ups dine together, and in her spare time she likes to urlLink crawl from place to place and urlLink gnaw on her sister's toys. Ladies and Gentleman, there she is...miss america. urlLink more pictures of soliel crawling...

this year i decided not to participate in the annual music festival at the hotsprings because i cant find my band. but i have located the keyboardist who just so happens to be part-timing at the hotsprings on summer break. so, it seems tuesday there will be a bus load of "foreigners" and high government officials in the foreign relations department and i've been asked to perform. it's going to have to be a rush job but we'll see what we can do. apparently a group from mexico is stopping by too. i hope they bring their chef with them! urlLink ...more...
Check out these pix shalom took on our recent trip to America! urlLink buried in sand urlLink mama&dada @ aardvark's urlLink go dodgers go urlLink mama in mexico urlLink mama&gpa

So i ended doing my swimming this morning and oh what a feeling. it was great, i think just what i need. who would think that excercise in the morning actually energizes you?! lunch at urlLink supermango was good. i had the urlLink super seafood hotpot . interestingly enough, every hotpot restaurant i've been to always serves some kind of ice product with the meal: ice cream, shaved ice, iced tea. this is only interesting because according to chinese medical practices, you're not suppose to eat something hot and then immediately afterwards, something cold. its bad for the stomach. furthermore, urlLink hot and cold arent limited to temerature only. if say you're really tired, you're skin's breaking out, and/or you have a coldsore, you should eat foods that have a cooling effect on your internal systems like: watermelon, bittermelon , green teas. but if you're body is cold inside (like you were just sick, or had a baby, or you have poor circulation) you should eat foods that are hot like: hot peppers, wine soups, fried foods, garlic--everything with flavor pretty much. urlLink more pictures of supermango...
dumpling lady next to her bamboo steamers urlLink steamed dumplings are a treat! urlLink more pictures...

we are experiencing technical difficulties with the poll results. not to fear, i can easily manipulate the outcome!
urlLink molemolemolemolemolemolemole

in slight relation to the "work life" post, on the news today was a list of stats by country regarding how much of the population diets. koreans were in first place with 90%, with half of the female population dieting + almost half of the male pop. ... how this relates? the media: another human invention.

I've decided to take the oral exam offered this year by the urlLink graduate institue of environmental policy management in december. test preparation materials will be disclosed in late august. i think this way i can also improve my chinese but i hear that most materials covered are in english while lectures are conduted in chinese. biung will be testing under another department within the same school of management. in taiwan, each university has its own exams so usually you only test once a year. urlLink national dong hua university's site
urlLink buy your fish while your motor's still running tasty

though i technically am a stay at home mom, i do feel that i am able to experience a little of the work life through biung. when he comes home late at night we'll chat about the days events and about the power struggles in the "food chain". it truly is complicated living and working in harmony with others regardless if your comrades are family or new friends. and it seems sad that such human inventions as money, can serve as the defining line between how close you'd let your comrades be. in all this, i propose that if since we have already created our society to be one that requires money to perpetuate itself and so would be difficult to expect a return to nature-- or more natural way of life, we start placing value on the things money cant buy, we might realize just how rich we are...and know that we cant bring our money with us anyways when we die. urlLink view pix of a link in the food chain who searches for food in our home late at night urlLink order your million dollar bill now! urlLink an inspirational website urlLink view pix of someone on the road to civilization-ization

it seems we're having technical difficulties with our poll results. as for the last poll, the vote was 50-50 between time travelling to the moment before the moment it all began, and the moment after it all ends.

Forget math and logic! i'm thinking about getting urlLink reason . i just spent all morning wasting my time making a beat that i cant convert into a wav file. doh!

as usual we were late for church this morning. we got there at 6:30.

urlLink These handy vehicles dont require licenses to drive and if you're old you can drive down the middle of the road in slow motion and people still wont honk at you! you can even tow other carts and there's even a holder for your cane!
Last night's cultural exchange with the mexican folklorico group was great. we even bought a bottle of taquilla. urlLink pix urlLink more pix
the results are in and it's a three way tie between green, green, and green!
urlLink this is not san francisco
urlLink pineapple patch urlLink for a closeup
due to popular demand, a new site has been created dedicated to " urlLink those handy vehicles "!

Because movies are slow to hit Taiwan and even slower to make it down to where i am, i recently saw Spiderman 2. I thought this time around, too much time was spent on the emotional aspects like we were back in the golden days of hollywood where pages of script were conveyed in a quick closeup on the eyes. peter parker's character was adorable but dont tell me they really couldn't think of another villian and so have to recycle spidey 1's. i dunno though, when i left the theater all i could think about was two things: i want to go to new york and your boyfriend is a freaking spider. even still, i was inspired by heroic integrity.

It occured to me that maybe i'm taking the "those handy vehicles" too seriously to the point where it could be putting me and my passengers into danger. i find that when i'm driving and i spot one of "those handy vehicles" i will even hold up traffic to get a good shot. on the other hand, the flow of traffic never exceeds 30mph.
urlLink workers in the back of a pick-up

Sometimes i don't really understand the humor but i've found that usually the joke is in your reaction. Like this morning, i went to do my hair and the hairdresser after finishing up said, 'come back next time and we'll give you a good looking hair style.'
I enjoy driving much of the time for the urlLink view .

the library here is great! you can get a library card for free and check out books for 28 days. granted, there are only 75 english books and they all seem to be from 1975. the reading room does have a few english magazines though, and you can copy entire books/zines for almost nothing regardless of copywrite laws.

On my day off, i went and saw Mean Girls by myself. don't laugh. it did satisfy my craving for a chick flick though the chicks were more like, how you say, tweens. i was entertained nonetheless. the plot: 16 year old home-schooled girl from africa is mainstream schooled by parents pursuing university tenure only to be sworn into the "plastics" (the popular good looking clique) all the while playing a double agent for an angst ridden outcast who wants revenge on the queen of plastics, but "africa" forgets or is purposely double crossing who knows? and in the end she is voted for homecoming queen and shares the crown with everyone over a heart-felt apology. i loved it! i was like, i want her skirt and her gloss! i think the main girl also played the young girl in the lastest version of Disney's "Parent Trap". urlLink pix
urlLink through the "green tunnel"
Coming in to town today, i spotted a urlLink rainbow and i started taking pictures of it like i've never seen a rainbow before. Kind of dangerous since i do this driving and kind of urlLink Lomo .
You can find many interesting things on the side of the road! urlLink view photo

I bought two tickets for the big lottery the other day. i think it was like 16 million or something. the sales lady put my tickets in a red envelope and wished me fortune in winning. people from japan were flying in just for a shot at the chance to win. the news reported that if you stacked the jackpot bill upon bill, its height would surpass the taipei 101. we spent 45 minutes talking about lottery related anecdotes and about what we would do with the money swearing we wouldnt let any amount change us. at 8:30 the winning numbers were announced. the anticlimax lasted till 8:33.

Tonight is saturday night, that means that there's something going down at the sugar factory. though the music festival is in full swing at the hotsprings, the sugar factory lends a little variety in the spices of life. at 7 or 8 there's a live band followed up with a live d.j. : brian from venice beach who helped me do urlLink my wall last year. there's always a lot of "foreigners" in those parts me thinks because they're all urlLink surfy smurfs . urlLink more... urlLink who wrote this one?... urlLink and we cant forget this one...
urlLink Good Morning Sunshine!

Or, Chinese Father's Day (Chinese in terms of language) because august 8th is pronounced ba ba--dad. So i went for a bike ride in the bike park today and now my legs are wobbley. i saw a cool mural on the Lanyu tribe. their tribe lives on a little island just off of the east coast and they have an annual urlLink boat dedication ceremony and their men's regalia is essentially a thong. but the govy is planning on making it a nuclear waste dump site because urlLink taiwan has 6? nuclear power plants! (note: you cant see taiwan on the map because its covered up with dots indicating number of nuclear power plants) Looking forward to an aesthetically questionable taiwan "look" in the future! urlLink pix of me biking
urlLink cool mural with flying fish
urlLink just like on the pch north

Cultural exchanges while i was out included a half chinese, half native american who performed tribal dances at the hotsprings. Though he is from Oregon, his dances were Meso American and he said that his ancestors eventually settled in oregon but werent originally from there. Name: RedWolf, tribe: Shoshone. Also, a half Maori, half Kiwi who will perform his urlLink hakka at a later date. we chatted about identity issues as a result of being "mixed". Didn't catch his name.

Rented some good anime including a korean effort: in the future, the ancestors of the EcoBan fled to a small island somewhere in the south pacific and created a self sustaining city dependent on pollution which is eventually slavishly created by the race of refugees in exchange for minimal necessities, the Marrians, who were denied entrance into the city upon their late arrival. the marrians and the ecoban live in a classed and differenciated society where the marrians ultimately revolt and an exiled ecoban hacks into the ecoban system, inserts a virus crashing the system but saving his and his childhood ecoban sweetheart's (and everybody else's) future. i fully enjoyed this anime and the visuals were great combining digi art with actual stills, i'm guessing. check it out: urlLink wonderful days .

Much has happened since the last time i've blogged. to break it down: kiddie fever, lots of dvds, more cultural exchanges, pressing on with bunun nyc, birthday parties, a stroll through the urlLink traditional market ...this week the AIT (American Institute in Taiwan) is on tour and coming to Taitung lending a good opportunity to add some pages to my passport.
